Pre-Game Insights: South Africa have won 3 out of 4 matches in this World Cup
Bangladesh have won 1 and lost 3 matches in this World Cup
South Africa have scored 300-plus every time they have batted first in this World Cup
Bangladesh's batting has been the main letdown, especially their tendency to suffer collapses and not capitalize on solid platforms
Miscellaneous Highlights: Head-to-Head: In 24 ODI played, South Africa won 18 matches while Bangladesh won 6 matches

Players to watch out for: South Africa: Quinton de Kock, Rassie van der Dussen, Aiden Markram, David Miller, Heinrich Klaasen, Bangladesh: Litton Das, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Shakib Al Hasan, Mehidy Hasan Miraz
Others: Pitch Report: The pitch at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai is a balanced pitch. The average 1st innings score at this venue in the last 20 matches is 252 runs. The pitch at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai is a sporting one with decent assistance for both batters and bowlers on offer. The team winning the toss may decide to bat or bowl depending on the ground conditions today.

Probable XIs: South Africa (SA): Quinton de Kock (WK), Temba Bavuma (C), Rassie van der Dussen, Aiden Markram, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Marco Jansen, Kagiso Rabada, Keshav Maharaj, Lungi Ngidi, Gerald Coetzee, Bangladesh (BAN): Litton Das, Tanzid Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Shakib al Hasan (C), Mushfiqur Rahim (WK), Mahmudullah, Nasum Ahmed, Hasan Mahmud, Mustafizur Rahman, Shoriful Islam
